00047 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00048 
00049 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00050 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00051 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00052 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00053 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00054 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00055 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00056 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00057 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00058 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)

00060 typedef unsigned long xnlock_t;
00061 
00062 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED 0
00063 
00064 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00065 
00066 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00067 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00068 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00069 
00070 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00071 
00072     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00073 }
00074 
00075 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00076 
00077 {
00078     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00079     spl_t flags;
00080 
00081     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00082 
00083     adeos_load_cpuid();
00084 
00085     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,lock))
00086         {
00087         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock))
00088             /* Use a non-locking test in the inner loop, as Linux'es
00089                bit_spin_lock. */
00090             while (test_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1, lock))
00091                 cpu_relax();
00092         }
00093     else
00094         flags |= 2;
00095 
00096     return flags;
00097 }
00098 
00099 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00100 
00101 {
00102     if (!(flags & 2))
00103         {
00104         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00105 
00106         rthal_cli();
00107 
00108         adeos_load_cpuid();
00109 
00110         if (test_bit(cpuid,lock))
00111             {
00112             clear_bit(cpuid,lock);
00113             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock);
00114             }
00115         }
00116 
00117     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00118 }
00119 
00120 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS /*empty*/
00121 
00122 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00123 
00124 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00125 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00126 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00127 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00128 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00129 
00130 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00183 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00184 
00185     /* Kernel mode side */
00186 
00187 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00188     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00189        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00190     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00191     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00192     struct task_struct *user_fpu_owner;
00193     /* Pointer the the FPU owner in userspace:
00194        - NULL for RT K threads,
00195        - last_task_used_math for Linux US threads (only current or NULL when MP)
00196        - current for RT US threads.
00197     */
00198 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00199 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00200 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00201 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00202 
00203     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00204     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00205     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00206     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00207 
00208     /* User mode side */
00209     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00210     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00211 
00212     /* Init block */
00213     struct xnthread *self;
00214     int imask;
00215     const char *name;
00216     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00217     void *cookie;
00218 
00219 } xnarchtcb_t;

00245 static inline long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (long long ts) {
00246     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00247 }
00248 
00249 static inline long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (long long ns) {
00250     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00251 }
00252 
00253 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00254     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00255 }

00257 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00258     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00259 }

00261 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00262     return adeos_processor_id();

00265 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00266 
00267 {
00268 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00269     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00270         return vmalloc(bytes);
00271 #endif
00272 
00273     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00274 }
00275 
00276 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00277 
00278 {
00279 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00280     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00281         vfree(chunk);
00282     else
00283 #endif
00284         kfree(chunk);
00285 }

00292 do { \
00293     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00294     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00295     show_stack(NULL,NULL);              \
00296     for (;;) ;                          \
00297 } while(0)

00302 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00303 
00304 {
00305     spl_t s;
00306     splhigh(s);
00307     splexit(!!imask);
00308     return !!s;
00309 }

00370 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00371 
00372 {
00373     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00374 
00375     adeos_load_cpuid();
00376 
00377     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00378        and always inside a critical section. */
00379     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00380     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00381     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00382 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00383     rootcb->user_fpu_owner = rthal_get_fpu_owner(rootcb->user_task);
00384     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00385     rootcb->fpup = (rootcb->user_fpu_owner
00386                     ? (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.fpr[0]
00387                     : NULL);
00388 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00389 }
00390 
00391 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00392     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00393 }
00394 
00395 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00396                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00397 {
00398     struct task_struct *prev = out_tcb->active_task;
00399     struct task_struct *next = in_tcb->user_task;
00400 
00401     in_tcb->active_task = next ?: prev;
00402 
00403     if (next && next != prev) /* Switch to new user-space thread? */
00404         {
00405         struct mm_struct *mm = next->active_mm;
00406 
00407         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00408 
00409 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00410         /* Don't rely on FTR fixups --
00411            they don't work properly in our context. */
00412         if (cur_cpu_spec[0]->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_ALTIVEC) {
00413             asm volatile (
00414                 "dssall;\n"
00415 #ifndef CONFIG_POWER4
00416                 "sync;\n"
00417 #endif
00418                 : : );
00419         }
00420 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00421 
00422         next->thread.pgdir = mm->pgd;
00423         get_mmu_context(mm);
00424         set_context(mm->context,mm->pgd);
00425 
00426 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00427         if (next->thread.regs && last_task_used_altivec == next)
00428             next->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_VEC;
00429 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00430 
00431 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00432         if (next->thread.regs && last_task_used_spe == next)
00433             next->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_SPE;
00434 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00435 
00436         _switch(&prev->thread, &next->thread);
00437         }
00438     else
00439         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00440         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00441 }
00442 
00443 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00444                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00445 {
00446     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00447 }
00448 
00449 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00450 
00451 {
00452     /* Empty */
00453 }
00454 
00455 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00456                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00457                                          const char *name)
00458 {
00459     tcb->user_task = current;
00460     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00461     tcb->ksp = 0;
00462     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00463 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00464     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00465     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00466 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00467     tcb->entry = NULL;
00468     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00469     tcb->self = thread;
00470     tcb->imask = 0;
00471     tcb->name = name;
00472 }
00473 
00474 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00475 
00476     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00477     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00478     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00479 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00480     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00481     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00482 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00483     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00484 }
00485 
00486 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00487 
00488 {
00489     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00490     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00491     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00492     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00493 }
00494 
00495 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00496                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00497                                        void *cookie,
00498                                        int imask,
00499                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00500                                        char *name)
00501 {
00502     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00503 
00504     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00505 
00506     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00507     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00508     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00509     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00510     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00511     ksp[26] = flags & ~(MSR_EE | MSR_FP); /* msr */
00512 
00513     tcb->entry = entry;
00514     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00515     tcb->self = thread;
00516     tcb->imask = imask;
00517     tcb->name = name;
00518 }
00519 
00520 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00521 
00522 {
00523 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00524     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00525        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00526     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00527     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00528 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00529 }
00530 
00531 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00532 
00533 {
00534 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00535 
00536     if(tcb->fpup)
00537         {
00538         rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00539 
00540         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00541             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr &= ~MSR_FP;
00542         }   
00543 
00544 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00545 }
00546 
00547 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00548 
00549 {
00550 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00551 
00552     if(tcb->fpup)
00553         {
00554         rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00555 
00556         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00557             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_FP;
00558         }   
00559 
00560     /* FIXME: We restore FPU "as it was" when RTAI preempted Linux, whereas we
00561        could be much lazier. */
00562     if(tcb->user_task)
00563         rthal_disable_fpu();
00564 
00565 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00566 }

00570 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00571 
00572     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00573 }
00574 
00575 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00576 
00577 {
00578     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00579                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00580                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00581                                      NULL,
00582                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00583 }
00584 
00585 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00586 
00587 {
00588     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00589                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00590                                      NULL,
00591                                      NULL,
00592                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00593 }

00595 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00596 
00597 {
00598     unsigned long flags = adeos_critical_enter(NULL);
00599     adeos_critical_exit(flags);
00600 }

00602 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */

00619     return 0;
00620 }
00621 
00622 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00623 
00624 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00625 
00626 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00627 
00628 {
00629 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00630     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00631        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00632     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00633 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00634 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00635     xnshadow_release_events();
00636 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00637     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00638     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00639     schedule_timeout(50);
00640     xnarch_release_ipi();
00641 }
00642 
00643 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00644 
00645 {
00646     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00647 
00648     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00649         {
00650         spl_t s;
00651         splsync(s);
00652         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00653         splexit(s);
00654         return 1;
00655         }
00656 
00657     return 0;
00658 }
00659 
00660 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00661 
00662 {
00663 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00664     xnshadow_grab_events();
00665 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00666 }
00667 
00668 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00669 
00670 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00671 
00672 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00673                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00674                                            const char *name)
00675 {
00676     struct task_struct *task = current;
00677 
00678     tcb->user_task = task;
00679     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00680     tcb->ksp = 0;
00681     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00682 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00683     tcb->user_fpu_owner = task;
00684     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00685 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00686     tcb->entry = NULL;
00687     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00688     tcb->self = thread;
00689     tcb->imask = 0;
00690     tcb->name = name;
00691 }
00692 
00693 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00694 
00695 {
00696     unsigned irq;
00697 
00698     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00699         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00700                              handler,
00701                              NULL,
00702                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00703 
00704     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00705        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00706        individually. */
00707 
00708     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00709                          handler,
00710                          NULL,
00711                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00712 }
00713 
00714 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00715 
00716 {
00717     unsigned irq;
00718 
00719     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00720         {
00721         switch (irq)
00722             {
00723 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00724             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00725 
00726                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00727                 continue;
00728 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00729 
00730             default:
00731 
00732                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00733             }
00734         }
00735 
00736     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00737 }
00738 
00739 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00740 
00741 {
00742     unsigned irq;
00743 
00744     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00745         {
00746         switch (irq)
00747             {
00748 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00749             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00750 
00751                 continue;
00752 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00753 
00754             default:
00755 
00756                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00757             }
00758         }
00759 
00760     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00761 }
00762 
00763 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00764 
00765 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00766 
00767 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00768     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00769        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00770        for now. If a timer needs more, a spurious but harmless call to
00771        the tick handler will occur after 4 billions ticks. Since the
00772        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00773        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */
00774     rthal_set_timer_shot(delay);
00775 }
00776 
00777 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00778     rthal_release_timer();
00779 }
00780 
00781 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00782 
00783 {
00784 #if CONFIG_SMP
00785     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00786 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00787     return 0;
00788 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00789 }
00790 
00791 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00792                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00793                                         unsigned long long defval)
00794 {
00795 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00796     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00797     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00798     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00799 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00800     *shot = defval;
00801     *delivery = defval;
00802 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00803 }
00804 
00805 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00811 static inline void xnarch_init_heapcb (xnarch_heapcb_t *hcb)
00812 
00813 {
00814     atomic_set(&hcb->numaps,0);
00815     hcb->kmflags = 0;
00816     hcb->heapbase = NULL;
00817 }

00819 static inline int xnarch_remap_page_range(struct vm_area_struct *vma,
00820                                           unsigned long uvaddr,
00821                                           unsigned long paddr,
00822                                           unsigned long size,
00823                                           pgprot_t prot)
00824 {
00825     return remap_pfn_range(vma,uvaddr,paddr >> PAGE_SHIFT,size,prot);
00826 }

00829 
00830 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00831 
00832 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00833 
00834 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00835 
00836 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00837 
00838 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00839 
00840 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00841 
00842 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00843 
00844 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00845 
00846 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00847 
00848 {
00849     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00850     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00851     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00852 }
00853 
00854 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00855 
00856 {
00857 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00858     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00859 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00860     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00861        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00862     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer()) ?: 1;
00863 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00864 }
00865 
00866 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00867 
00868 {
00869     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00870 
00871     if (!nktimerlat)
00872         return -ENODEV;
00873 
00874     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00875 
00876     return 0;
00877 }
00878 
00879 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00880 
00881 {
00882     int err;
00883 
00884 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00885     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00886        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00887     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00888 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00889 
00890     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00891 
00892     if (err)
00893         return err;
00894 
00895     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00896 
00897     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00898         return -ENOSYS;
00899 
00900     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00901                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00902                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00903                               NULL,
00904                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00905 
00906     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00907 
00908 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00909     err = xnshadow_mount();
00910 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00911 
00912     if (err)
00913         {
00914         rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00915         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00916         }
00917 
00918     return err;
00919 }
00920 
00921 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00922 
00923 {
00924 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00925     xnshadow_cleanup();
00926 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00927     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00928     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00929 }
00930 
00931 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00932 
00933 #ifdef __cplusplus
00934 }
00935 #endif

00942 #define xnarch_post_graph(obj,state)
00943 #define xnarch_post_graph_if(obj,state,cond)
